2.text: Suffer me a little, and I will show you that I have yet to speak on Godâ€™s behalf.

3.text: I will fetch my knowledge from afar, and will ascribe righteousness to my Maker.

4.text: For truly my words shall not be false: he that is perfect in knowledge is with you.

5.text: Behold, God is mighty, and despises not any: he is mighty in strength and wisdom.

6.text: He preserves not the life of the wicked: but gives right to the poor.

7.text: He withdraws not his eyes from the righteous: but with kings are they on the throne; yes, he does establish them for ever, and they are exalted.

8.text: And if they be bound in fetters, and be held in cords of affliction;

9.text: Then he shows them their work, and their transgressions that they have exceeded.

10.text: He opens also their ear to discipline, and commands that they return from iniquity.

11.text: If they obey and serve him, they shall spend their days in prosperity, and their years in pleasures.

12.text: But if they obey not, they shall perish by the sword, and they shall die without knowledge.

13.text: But the hypocrites in heart heap up wrath: they cry not when he binds them.

14.text: They die in youth, and their life is among the unclean.

15.text: He delivers the poor in his affliction, and opens their ears in oppression.

16.text: Even so would he have removed you out of the strait into a broad place, where there is no narrow place; and that which should be set on your table should be full of fatness.

17.text: But you have fulfilled the judgment of the wicked: judgment and justice take hold on you.

18.text: Because there is wrath, beware lest he take you away with his stroke: then a great ransom cannot deliver you.

19.text: Will he esteem your riches? no, not gold, nor all the forces of strength.

20.text: Desire not the night, when people are cut off in their place.

21.text: Take heed, regard not iniquity: for this have you chosen rather than affliction.

22.text: Behold, God exalts by his power: who teaches like him?

23.text: Who has enjoined him his way? or who can say, You have worked iniquity?

24.text: Remember that you magnify his work, which men behold.

25.text: Every man may see it; man may behold it afar off.

26.text: Behold, God is great, and we know him not, neither can the number of his years be searched out.

27.text: For he makes small the drops of water: they pour down rain according to the vapor thereof:

28.text: Which the clouds do drop and distil on man abundantly.

29.text: Also can any understand the spreading of the clouds, or the noise of his tabernacle?

30.text: Behold, he spreads his light on it, and covers the bottom of the sea.

31.text: For by them judges he the people; he gives meat in abundance.

32.text: With clouds he covers the light; and commands it not to shine by the cloud that comes between.

33.text: The noise thereof shows concerning it, the cattle also concerning the vapor.
